conclusion: Use the ideal gas law PV = nRT to determine the temperature of the gas at state C.
The gas returns to its initial state after undergoing the cycle, so n and R remain constant.
Given: At state A, P_A = 1 x 10^5 Pa, V_A = 2 L, and T_A = 200 K.
Calculate the number of moles n using the ideal gas law at state A: n = P_A V_A / (R T_A).
Substitute the values: n = (1 x 10^5 Pa) x (2 x 10^-3 m^3) / (R x 200 K).
At state C, P_C = 1 x 10^5 Pa and V_C = 5 L.
Using the ideal gas law at state C: T_C = P_C V_C / (nR).
Substitute the values: T_C = (1 x 10^5 Pa) x (5 x 10^-3 m^3) / (nR).
Substitute nR = (1 x 10^5 Pa) x (2 x 10^-3 m^3) / 200 K into the equation for T_C.
Simplify the expression: T_C = (5 x 10^-3 m^3) / (2 x 10^-3 m^3) x 200 K.
The temperature of the gas at state C is 500 K.
